snippet: To a large extent, the N.C.A.A. process is a case of two wrongs making a right, counterbalancing R.P.I. flaws by making a series of mental adjustments to it.
abstract: Nate Silver's FiveThirtyEight blog on the process the NCAA uses to select and seed the 68-team men’s basketball tournament; says it is a case of two wrongs making a right, counterbalancing flaws in Ratings Percentage Index, or RPI, by making a series of mental adjustments to it.
lead_paragraph: To a large extent, the N.C.A.A. process is a case of two wrongs making a right, counterbalancing R.P.I. flaws by making a series of mental adjustments to it.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Builds Solid Brackets From a Shaky Foundation
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Builds Solid Brackets From a Shaky Foundation
